title: NIR test program reveals factors affecting flexible packaging sorting - Labels and Labeling
summary: The article discusses a study on how NIR technology can enhance the design for recycling of flexible plastic packaging through rigorous testing of various material structures and packaging elements. The research aims to provide data to optimize sorting processes and improve circular design decisions for packaging, with the results available for public access on the CEFLEX website.
green_innovation: TRUE: The article focuses on improving the recycling and sustainability of flexible plastic packaging through advanced technology and research, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE: The article primarily discusses technological advancements and research in recycling packaging materials rather than introducing new products or business processes to the market.
green_product: TRUE: The article highlights the design and recycling aspects of flexible plastic packaging, aiming to reduce environmental impact throughout its life cycle, making it a green product.
green_process: TRUE: The article discusses how the use of NIR technology can improve the sorting and recycling processes of flexible plastic packaging, emphasizing environmental impact reduction and sustainable manufacturing practices.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541712 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences; 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services; 325211 - Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing; 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities
greenwashing: FALSE: The article presents a detailed study on how NIR technology can enhance recycling processes for flexible plastic packaging, focusing on factual data and research rather than making false environmental claims.
